alert.note: Alert for Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 4:27PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Brewster and southeastern Jeff Davis Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 427 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near McDonald Observatory, or 7 miles northwest of Fort Davis, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Davis, McDonald Observatory, Davis Mountains State Park, Black Mountain, Indian Lodge and Fort Davis National Historical Site. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southwestern Texas.
